==Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|nl|dum|beginnen}}, from {{inh|nl|odt|biginnan}}, from {{inh|nl|gem-pro|*biginnaną}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|nl|/bəˈɣɪnə(n)/}} * {{audio|nl|Nl-beginnen.ogg|audio}} * {{hyphenation|nl|be|gin|nen}} * {{rhymes|nl|ɪnən}} ===Verb=== {{nl-verb}} # {{lb|nl|ergative}} to [[begin]] ====Inflection==== {{nl-conj-st|class=3|pref=be|gin|gon|gonnen|ginne|gonne|aux=zijn}} ====Synonyms==== * {{l|nl|starten}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|nl|stoppen}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|nl|beginnen}} * {{l|nl|beginsel}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|af|begin}} ---- ==German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|de|gmh|beginnen}}, from {{inh|de|goh|biginnan}}, from {{inh|de|gem-pro|*biginnaną}}. Cognate with {{cog|nds|beginnen}}, {{cog|nl|beginnen}}, {{cog|fy|begjinne}}, and {{cog|en|begin}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/bəˈɡɪnən/|[bəˈɡɪnən]|[bəˈɡɪnn̩]}} * {{audio|de|De-beginnen.ogg|audio (Germany)}} * {{audio|de|De-at-beginnen.ogg|audio (Austria)}} ===Verb=== {{de-verb-strong|class=3|beginnt|begann|begonnen}} # {{lb|de|intransitive}} to [[begin]]; to [[commence]]; to be started #: ''Der Vortrag hat '''begonnen'''.'' — “The lecture has '''begun'''.” # {{lb|de|chiefly|literary|transitive|_|or with|_|{{l|de|mit}}}} to [[start]] something; to [[begin]] something #: ''Er hat den Vortrag '''begonnen.''''' — “He has '''started''' the lecture.” #: ''Er hat mit dem Vortrag '''begonnen.''''' — “He has '''started''' the lecture.” ====Usage notes==== * ''Beginnen'' is relatively rare in colloquial German and is most often replaced with {{m|de|anfangen}}. This is particularly true of the sense “to start something”. * In literary German, ''beginnen'' is often preferred to ''anfangen'', though both are perfectly acceptable. ====Conjugation==== {{de-conj-strong|beginn|begann|begonnen|h|||begänn|7b=begönn|a}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|Beginnen}} * {{l|de|Beginner}} * {{l|de|Beginn}} * {{l|de|beginnend}} * {{l|de|begonnen}} ====Related terms==== * {{l|de|beenden}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} ---- ==Middle Dutch== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|dum|odt|biginnan}}, from {{inh|dum|gem-pro|*biginnaną}}. ===Verb=== {{dum-verb}} # to [[begin]], to [[start]] # to [[arise]], to [[originate]] ====Inflection==== {{rfinfl|dum|verb}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|dum|beginninge}} * {{l|dum|beginsel}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|nl|beginnen}} * {{desc|li|beginne}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:VMNW|ID37341|beghinnen|II}} * {{R:MNW|02764}} ---- ==Middle High German== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gmh|goh|biginnan}}, from {{inh|gmh|gem-pro|*biginnaną}}. Cognate with {{cog|en|begin}} and {{cog|nl|beginnen}}. ===Verb=== {{head|gmh|verb}} # to [[begin]] ====Conjugation==== {{gmh-conj-IIIa-insep|beg|nn}} ====Descendants==== * {{desc|de|beginnen}}
